IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Educate and train students with intellectual and developmental disabilities
IRS990.MissionDesc: Shepherds Baptist Ministries, Inc. exists to educate and train students with intellectual and developmental disabilities by equipping them to reach Appropriate Independence (continued on Schedule O)through the development of vocational, social, and life skills while inspiring a lasting awareness of God's plan for their lives.
IRS990.Desc: Shepherds College is the nation's leading, fully-accredited non-degree granting, post-secondary education program created with the learning needs of students with intellectual and developmental disabilities in mind. Shepherds College believes that when students learn in an environment designed specifically for them, they will thrive, and offers three, immersive occupational majors. The college equips students to reach Appropriate Independence through the development of vocational, social and life skills. As a faith-based school, spiritual growth is encouraged through weekly chapel meetings, Bible studies, attendance at local churches, and student-led prayer groups. (continued on Schedule O)The school pursues excellence in all its operations, evidenced by its exceptional faculty and staff, the new and recently updated student housing facilities, customized curriculum, and its investment in impacting the disability community through strategic leadership training. Operations are funded primarily from payment for tuition fees with contributions from Shepherds Foundation, Inc.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income:

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The organization is a school as described under 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) and is not required to complete a public support schedule. Schedule A, Part II is completed to verify the School can qualify under public charity status section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and qualifies to use the first listed special rule for Schedule B reporting.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: Discount for future interest in pooled income fund

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Shepherds Foundation, Inc. a related organization, holds and administers the endowment fund for the purpose of supporting the mission of Shepherds Baptist Ministries, Inc.
The organization publicized its racially nondiscriminatory policy on the homepage of its website at all times during its tax year in a manner reasonably expected to be noticed by visitors.

Line 4b - This question is answered "no" since Shepherds Baptist Ministries, Inc. only evaluates numeric information when awarding scholarships. The organization intends to make the necessary changes so that this question can be answered "yes" in the future.

Shepherds Baptist Ministries, Inc. receives funding from Federal Student Aid, Higher Education Emergency Relief Funds (HEERF) under the CARES act, and various state Medicaid waiver funds including vocational rehab funds.

This question is answered "no" since Shepherds Baptist Ministries, Inc. does not currently have the racially nondiscriminatory policy published in their printed student materials. This change will be made going forward so that this question can be answered "yes" in the future.

Tuition discounts, scholarships, and awards are given by the College. The College notifies the business office of the award amount for each student. The majority of scholarships are Needs-Based and awarded based on completing of a FAFSA with FSA. There are a few scholarships that are a Professional Referral Scholarship where an educator is allowed to present a potential student with a certificate that will allow them to receive a scholarship. That amount is applied directly to each student's account and no cash changes hands.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee consists of all officers of the corporation who are directors of the corporation, the chairperson of each of the standing committees, except the Board Development Committee, and additional members of the Board known as Members at Large elected annually at the time of election of officers. The Executive Committee conducts the business of the corporation between regular Board of Directors' meetings within the general policies set by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared and reviewed by an independent CPA firm, reviewed in detail and approved by certain members of the organization's board and management, and a final copy of the reviewed return is presented to the full board before filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members and officers are required to disclose potential conflicts on an annual basis. The Board Chairman and Board Secretary monitor the process. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The independent members of the Board of Directors review and approve the compensation for the President of the organization. The Board of Directors uses comparability data in their analysis. Their decision is documented in the board minutes. Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b: The independent members of the Board of Directors review and approve the compensation for the other officers of the organization. Their decision is documented in the board minutes. The organization is in the process of implementing comparability data into the compensation determination process for the other officers. This question will be answered "yes" on the 6/30/2023 tax return.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are made available to the public upon request.
Change in value of annuities -127,302. Change in value of trusts -49,327.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Supporting Organization to Shepherds Baptist Ministry, Inc.
